page.title: 15Memory.N.Runcton & Middleton
page.content: We spoke to five old people in Middleton and North Runcton about their childhood and their working lives. One spoke about larger families when she was young. She was the eldest of 11 children. All referred to the{games}they played as children such as marbles, hopscotch, skipping, and bowling hoops. These are rare in the present television age. Some left{school}as early as 12 years old. A few stayed until they were 15. All but one had all their schooling at the village school from the age of 5 until they started work. The men had been farmworkers, the main{employment}in their villages. One of the women had been in service as a maid at Hillington, one had worked in a shop in Kings Lynn, and one had worked as a typist.
